_comment: Created by rreed on 06/07/2017 08:47:09 using v2.7
title: How has the number of managerial staff in the NHS changed over time?
analysis_commentary:
Contrary to popular belief, between September 2009 and January 2017, there was a substantial decrease in the number of managers (18% decrease) and senior managers (17% decrease) employed by English NHS. In September 2009 there were 11,892 senior managers and 25,687 managers, which dropped to 9,930 and 21,002 respectively by January 2017.

Updated April 2017.
